_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The things that the noble ones have seen: Happiness is the cessation of identity
This insight contradicts the whole world
What others say is happiness and sufferi: What others say is happiness, the noble ones say is suffering
What others say is suffering, the noble ones know as happiness
The people who can and cannot understand: The good are open and can understand
Fools inexpert in the teaching are mired in desire to be reborn and cannot understand
The state that only the noble ones can u: When they've rightly understood it, they're extinguished without defilements.
